New Records: Jackson Chourio moved closer to becoming the youngest player in Major League history to log a 20/20 season.
Key Match Events: Jackson Chourio hit a go-ahead, ninth-inning home run in Milwaukee’s 5-4 win over the Reds.
Blake Perkins robbed a home run to preserve a 4-4 tie in the sixth inning.
Jake Bauers made a game-ending defensive gem in the bottom of the ninth to secure the win.
Post-Match Reflections: Jake Bauers commented on Jackson Chourio's performance, calling him 'special'.
Blake Perkins expressed excitement about Chourio's future with the Brewers.
Manager Pat Murphy reflected on Chourio's resilience and contribution to the game despite his injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers' victory kept them 10 games up on the Cubs in the National League Central standings and tied with the Phillies for the second-best record in the NL.
